result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenny D. Matthias was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenny D. Matthias

Defendant Kenny D. Matthias in court.  Kristi S. Tlusty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tlusty places agreement on the record. Vicitm rights complied. Advised to right to attorney.  Waived at these proceedings.  Defendant pleads no contest to charge.  Plea colloquy.  Factual basis exists.  Court finds plea given freely, voluntarily and intellegently; accepts plea; finds DE guilty. Court imposed payment of court costs; DNA sample and surcharge. ba
